intro: Cerastium argentinum, commonly known as the Argentine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically forms a mat of hairy, oval leaves and is often found in rocky or disturbed soils. It thrives in temperate climates and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and as a ground cover.
